intro: Silene stapfii, commonly known as the Stapf's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. Silene stapfii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
